page.title: 14INTERVIEW WITH MR.ALLISON
page.content: THE VILLAGE WAS A THRIVING COMMUNITY WHICH HAS BEEN CHANGED INTO A BACK- WATER.THIS IS MAINLY DUE TO THE BYPASS BUT ALSO BECAUSE OF THE CLOSURE OF THE QUARRY AT HELBECK AND THE CLOSURE OF THE RAILWAY.THE ONLY LARGE EMPLOYER IS THE MINISTRY OF DEFENCE AT WARCOP. BROUGH IS QUIETER FOR RESIDENTS SINCE THE BYPASS WAS BUILT.IT ALWAYS DEPENDED ON THE ROAD SINCE THE DAYS WHEN IT WAS A STOPPING PLACE FOR STAGE COACHES.WITHOUT THE ROAD THE TOWN IS DOOMED WITHOUT ALTERNATIVE EMPLOYMENT. THERE WAS A CINEMA AT KIRKBY STEPHEN THERE WERE WEEKLY DANCES AT THE MEMORIAL HALL,NOW ONLY USED FOR THE YOUTH CLUB.THERE STILL ARE BILLIARDS AND SNOOKER.THERE WERE TENNIS COURTS WHERE THE FOOTBALL PITCH IS AND THE SWIMMING POOL WAS FILLED IN WHEN THE BYPASS WAS BUILT.
